Very good game.

Don't get the game if you are looking for a game that's fair, balanced, full of content.

Every game is a rinse and repeat. The killer is almost twice as fast as the survivor and there are perks within the game that lets the killer see you which gets rid of the point of being stealthy.

The game tries to give you second chance but in reality, if the killer sees you once and hooks you, he is able to hit you almost instantly after being unhooked and hook you the second time when it is your teammate's fault for doing an unsafe unhook.

The hardest part in the game is to escape from the killer, yet you get the least amount of points for escaping a killer. or you could be distracting the killer for half of the game and only get 300 points, while the killer passes a survivor and the game gives the afk survivor 300.

You better get your wallet out because you definitely will be in the advantage buying a non-free killer than a free killer (pay to win).

The items within the game are cool, except the rare ones take a long time to collect, and after each game, if you don't survive, you will lose the items. The perks are quite useless, they barely have an effect on the game when you compare to the killer's "once hooked, the killer can assassinate the survivor" perk.

Animations: The animations look like a student has done his first experiment on computer aided design. The faces the survivors pull when they die is a joke, not to mention the pyramid head['s cage had metallic spikes dancing on each corner of the cage which is ridiculous.

conclusion, play another game to show your true capabilities.

Очень своеобразная игра, в ней не заскучаешь, правда, ежели у вас наигранно примерное кол-во часов (800+ (может чуть меньше)), она потихоньку будет надоедать вам. Но не стоит забывать, что эту игру апгрейдят разрабы и с каждым апргрейдом, вновь приходит новый интерес сыграть в эту замечательную игру. Эта игра предназначена для друзей, как многие из вас уже успели заметить, но ежели вы волк одиночка, за вас игра предоставит ваших тиммейтов.

My favorite game for the past 2 years!

Ох, отыграв 400 часов в игре я могу все-таки оставить отзыв.
В начале было очень интересно. Но в последнее время игра надоела. Ничего нового,даже DLCшки не влияют на интерес к игре.Да новые маны и сурвы появляются, но механика игры все та же. Все те же 5 генов и тотемы,все. Не хватает чего-то нового. 
Играть без друзей-не интересно. Либо попадутся сурвы, которым вообще все-равно на команду, либо те, кто вообще не понятно чем занимается всю катку. 
Манов порой жалко. Если попадется полная тима, то скорее всего они будут токсичными и начнется сплошное издевательство над маном. Но бывают и маны козлы))Например,один из типичных представителей: Бубба-Кемпер) (Ну серьезно,с таким сталкивался каждый). А так кемперство и туннелерство раздражает,и это никак не наказывается (ведь это стиль игры такой).
Что касается багов..ничего не хочу говорить))Это нужно видеть)Меня они веселят скорее,чем нервируют:)
Если вы не знакомы с этой игрой, то рекомендую к покупке однозначно! (можете сразу закинуть в корзину вместе с DLC Shattered Bloodline Chapter (сильный ман-Рин), Spark of Madness Chapter (так же имбовый Доктор),ну а насчет выживших не скажу,т.к. базовые не плохие сами по себе). :)

Now that I've had more time in the game, I'd like to ammend my review a bit... however I still do not reccomend it.

If you have a group of people to play with (especially out of country) this is the better game for just having worldwide support, but it's hardly the superior option, it's just the ONLY option in some countries.

I'll start with the positives, the first person perspective does make being a killer feel a little more immersive... but ultimately ends up as players hiding in your literal blindspots 90% of the time, something that doesn't really lend itself to horror. Some of the abilities that use space in a 3 dimensional way can be interesting, but doesn't result in much for most killers. And Ebony momento moris are basically the fatalities of this game, over the top ways too finish someone off... that actually awards less points than hanging them on a hook. I don't know how you can kill 2 survivors this way and the entity still be displeased.

Which gets me to my next point, all aspects of "grading" for the game (killer) are counterintuitive, you get punished if survivors heal... but everyone uses self-care. You get punished for being too close to the hook, but if you don't secure the kill, they'll just heal up again. Survivors only have 2 levels of grading, you either escaped or got sacrificed. And if you didn't play the game the EXACT way Behavior wants you to, you get punished and barred from entering rank 1... which doesn't matter because you'll get matched against rank 1's no matter how good or bad you are. 

It's still hot garbage in how much they treat their players like atms even now. Some characters are literally gatekept behind paid only DLC, that means there are some characters in this game you can't even USE unless you pay to use them. Competitor games, such as Identity V, have ALL characters available via in game currency, with the only paid thing being cosmetic stuff.

The perk system would be nice in theory... IF IT WASN'T COMPLETELY RANDOM when you'd get the perk... YOU UNLOCKED, AND IN SOME CASES PAID FOR. That's right, you can't even have access to the things you unlock unless that EXACT perk just HAPPENS to be on the bloodweb. Well, just grind a bit more, what's the harm? It took nearly 1,000,000 bloodpoints to unlock the perks on the killer I wanted to use plus the initial 700k bloopoints to get to level 40. For reference, if you do well in a game, you only get about 30k sometimes 60k if you have the right perks, nevermind if you don't. So you're looking at at least 60 games, underpowered until you can play the killer/survivor the way you want... if you play every game perfectly, double if you're learning.

The worst part is the shrine of secrets having abilities THAT THE FREE CHARACTERS already have, so it's pretty much a crap shoot of when you're ever going to get a perk that's worth anything, UNLESS there HAPPENS to be an event going on. A much better system would to have ALL the perks available at all times so players can grind and focus on the ones they want instead of the one's Behavior thinks we want. But again, that wouldn't be lucrative to Behavior.

Dead by Daylight's matchmaking and report system is an absolute joke, so there's zero incentive to play fair or respect people in game. As a killer main, who uses perks that require a hook, I can't say how many times I've had a survivor disconnect just to spite me. And Behavior basically encourages this by their hands off approach to it. Giving props does nothing, reporting does nothing, and often as a beginner, you'll be matched with people who have been playing for years, because they can't be bothered to make it a fair experience for everyone. Identity V ironically has figured out this problem, and generally matches players with people in the same rank... imagine that, now if only there was a number that one could get matched with... nah, throw the level 16 killer against some rank 4 survivors, that'll be okay.

Which would be alright... IF YOU COULD ACTUALLY PRACTICE IN SOME WAY. Even Identity V has some rudimentary bots that you can practice new hunters/survivors (yes, you're allowed at all times to practice characters you don't have yet to decide if you want to buy them) before buying them, or landing your abilities. In DbD, you're cornholed into buyer's remorse if you don't like how the killer plays. Which reminds me, besides the unique perks, pretty much all survivors are the same, and can only use 3 different tools. IDV has over 35 survivors with unique abilities like teleporting, manipulating a robot character, flying, summoning a swarm of bees, etc.

On top of that, these abilities and addons are refreshed at the beginning of each game in IDV, whereas in DbD, once they're used they're gone, so you better hope a brand new part appears on the web again and soon, otherwise you're going to be at a disadvantage. These addons should be permanent things that let players play the characters how they want (albeit, as it is now some would need some rebalancing), but instead it's another grindfest to get players to pay to win. 

The cosmetics are also a joke void of any risk or creativity often being nothing more than just a different set of clothes (but lacking any theme at the same time), but requiring months of grinding, or an easy payment of 10 dollars! I can safely say, not a single cosmetic has stood out or even enticed me in DbD. Which I understand, the game is supposed to be gritty and gross, but for example, for Oni there's his base skin... then there's a different one that's just him without his armor on for 10 bucks (you can't use shards). Whereas in IDV, there's mechanic's base skin, then there's one that makes her look like a gothic red riding hood... which can be unlocked with ingame currency, and there's a different one that makes her look like an asylum patient

I'm not saying Identity V is perfect, that game has problems too (*cough* Wuchang), but there's at least a modicum of respect for the players themselves, and not gatekeeping the tools to win behind random dice rolls and bloodwebs that take months to unlock. 

So why did I waste 200 hours of my life playing it? So you don't have to. I have people I know who make the experience less of a migraine too, but if you're going into this solo, save your money for a better game.

Overall, has a very repetitive sense of two different playstyles. Where killing requires significantly more concentration, a survivor is somewhat more chill as an experienced player but is often an M1 simulator if you don't involve yourself with the game much. This receptivity is very clear, but the different survivors you play against all have different playstyles, and the killers have completely different "powers" which can tilt the game at any point. If you want a more relaxing experience to sit down and play something, then it would be better to play survivor. Killer requires endless concentration and intense focus so you need to be in a proper gaming mood.
I would highly recommend this game to someone who needs a time-waster video game and wants to funnel some hours into it in their spare time. It's a good horror for the first 50 hours but loses that factor after you stop taking the game seriously in terms of getting scared. There is a grinding system involved which will take anyone a long time to get anything especially the bare bone amount you earn in-game, but achieving the grind and getting the perks (massive game factor) that you want that will greatly change the way you play.
It's just amazing and the game I turn on every day for a good 6+ hours.
Painful, but enjoyable experiance. 11/10
